nodes.text: What part of the landline phone are you working on?
Is the phone speaker accessible without tools?

options.label: No, screws or clips are securing it.

steps.action: Carefully pry off the speaker cover using a plastic tool.
Gently lift and disconnect the speaker module from its housing or wires.
Unscrew the casing screws to open the phone body.
Locate the speaker and remove any additional securing screws or clips.
Unplug or cut the speaker wires carefully if no connector is present.

nodes.text: Is the phone board immediately visible after opening the casing?

steps.action: Unscrew the mounting screws holding the board in place.
Carefully disconnect attached components (keypad, speaker wires, handset cable).
Lift the board straight out of the casing.
Remove any blocking parts (e.g., button pads, microphone module) gently.
Detach all connected wires and cables.
Extract the board carefully without damaging connectors.

nodes.text: All selected components have been processed. Proceed to final disposal or recycling.
